unnormalised: Infosys announced a new training program for freshers focused on cloud-native software development. The course aims to skill up new recruits in technologies like Kubernetes, Docker, and serverless functions. Training will commence on 15/07/2024 and will be conducted online over a period of 12 weeks.
normalised: Infosys announced a new training program for freshers focused on cloud-native software development. The course aims to skill up new recruits in technologies like K-u-bernetes, Docker, and serverless functions. Training will commence on fifteenth july two thousand and twenty four and will be conducted online over a period of twelve weeks.

unnormalised: The program will cover key areas such as Microservices architecture, DevOps practices, and API management. Experienced developers from Infosys will lead the sessions, providing hands-on guidance. Students will learn to build and deploy applications on platforms like AWS, Azure, and GCP. Successful completion of the course guarantees placement within Infosys with an avg. salary of Rs. 4.5 LPA.
normalised: The program will cover key areas such as Microservices architecture, D-ev-O-ps practices, and A-P-I management. Experienced developers from Infosys will lead the sessions, providing hands-on guidance. Students will learn to build and deploy applications on platforms like A-W-S, Azure, and G-C-P. Successful completion of the course guarantees placement within Infosys with an average salary of rupees four point five L-P-A.

unnormalised: Infosys aims to onboard 500 new software developers in the 2024 intake. Applications are open until 30/06/2024. Eligible candidates must have a BE/B.Tech degree in Computer Science or a related field with a min. of 60% marks.
normalised: Infosys aims to onboard five hundred new software developers in the two thousand and twenty four intake. Applications are open until thirtieth june two thousand and twenty four. Eligible candidates must have a B-E slash B-Tech degree in Computer Science or a related field with a minimum of sixty percent marks.
